body:
Comment 15: 
It looks like 2.3 is the minimum requirement to use the linux-386 binary distro of
go1.2rc1, downloaded here:
  https://go.googlecode.com/files/go1.2rc1.linux-386.tar.gz

$ readelf -V go

Version symbols section '.gnu.version' contains 22 entries:
 Addr: 0000000008649d20  Offset: 0x601d20  Link: 13 (.dynsym)
  000:   0 (*local*)       1 (*global*)      1 (*global*)      1 (*global*)   
  004:   5 (GLIBC_2.0)     4 (GLIBC_2.1)     5 (GLIBC_2.0)     5 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  008:   3 (GLIBC_2.0)     5 (GLIBC_2.0)     5 (GLIBC_2.0)     2 (GLIBC_2.1)  
  00c:   2 (GLIBC_2.1)     2 (GLIBC_2.1)     5 (GLIBC_2.0)     5 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  010:   5 (GLIBC_2.0)     5 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     5 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  014:   5 (GLIBC_2.0)     5 (GLIBC_2.0)  

Version needs section '.gnu.version_r' contains 2 entries:
 Addr: 0x0000000008649d60  Offset: 0x601d60  Link: 12 (.dynstr)
  000000: Version: 1  File: libpthread.so.0  Cnt: 2
  0x0010:   Name: GLIBC_2.1  Flags: none  Version: 2
  0x0020:   Name: GLIBC_2.0  Flags: none  Version: 3
  0x0030: Version: 1  File: libc.so.6  Cnt: 2
  0x0040:   Name: GLIBC_2.1  Flags: none  Version: 4
  0x0050:   Name: GLIBC_2.0  Flags: none  Version: 5

$ readelf -V 8l

Version symbols section '.gnu.version' contains 60 entries:
 Addr: 000000000804893c  Offset: 0x00093c  Link: 6 (.dynsym)
  000:   0 (*local*)       2 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  004:   3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     4 (GLIBC_2.1.3)   3 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  008:   5 (GLIBC_2.1)     0 (*local*)       0 (*local*)       3 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  00c:   6 (GLIBC_2.2)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  010:   3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  014:   3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  018:   3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  01c:   3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     7 (GLIBC_2.3)     6 (GLIBC_2.2)  
  020:   3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     6 (GLIBC_2.2)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  024:   3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  028:   2 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  02c:   3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     7 (GLIBC_2.3)  
  030:   3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  034:   3 (GLIBC_2.0)     5 (GLIBC_2.1)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)     3 (GLIBC_2.0)  
  038:   3 (GLIBC_2.0)     1 (*global*)      1 (*global*)      1 (*global*)   

Version needs section '.gnu.version_r' contains 2 entries:
 Addr: 0x00000000080489b4  Offset: 0x0009b4  Link: 7 (.dynstr)
  000000: Version: 1  File: libc.so.6  Cnt: 5
  0x0010:   Name: GLIBC_2.3  Flags: none  Version: 7
  0x0020:   Name: GLIBC_2.2  Flags: none  Version: 6
  0x0030:   Name: GLIBC_2.1  Flags: none  Version: 5
  0x0040:   Name: GLIBC_2.1.3  Flags: none  Version: 4
  0x0050:   Name: GLIBC_2.0  Flags: none  Version: 3
  0x0060: Version: 1  File: libm.so.6  Cnt: 1
  0x0070:   Name: GLIBC_2.0  Flags: none  Version: 2


So I'm curious about the original issue report, where the problem was encountered on a
system running glibc 2.3. If readelf says 2.3 is the minimum, why wouldn't it have
worked?
